p: Carvacrol (33.15–73.77%), γ-terpinene (4.20–10.53%) and p-cymene (7.10–9.71%) were the major components found in all the highly effective bi- and tripartite blends of EOs against A. veronii bv. sobria. Blend #11, which consisted of Greek oregano and Spanish oregano (1:1), showed the highest cumulative amount of carvacrol (73.77%), while the percentage content of this compound in individual EOs was lower (i.e., 42.0% and 72.0% in EOs of Spanish oregano and Greek oregano, respectively. Carvacrol was detected in higher amounts in blends #8, #16 and #31 (56.36%, 56.78% and 65.78%, respectively) compared to its amounts found in the individual EOs of savoury (32.8%) and Spanish oregano (42.0%).
